questions.question: What 2 elements were created during the Big Bang?

choices.answer: Carbon, Hydrogen
Hydrogen, Helium
Hydrogen, Boron
Helium, Neon,
Many billions of stars
Moons and planets
Two stars orbiting each other
About one hundred stars

questions.question: Red shift of starlight is observed in 7 nearby stars. What do you know about their movement?

choices.answer: The stars are not moving relative to Earth.
The stars are moving towards Earth.
The stars are moving away from Earth.

questions.question: A space probe can only travel 8 light years from Earth, what star cannot be reached?

choices.answer: Star A
Star B
Star C
Star D

questions.question: All the naturally occurring elements on Earth came from ...?

choices.answer: formed by black holes scattered throughout the galaxy
formed by nuclear fusion in massive, ancient stars
formed by radioactive decay within the Earth's core
formed by comets and asteroids falling to Earth

questions.question: Which stars have the greatest red shift?

choices.answer: Stars closest to Earth where we can see them better.
Stars nearest the Sun where light is more plentiful.
Stars farthest from Earth with the greatest speed.
Stars in the nearest galaxy that are spinning.

questions.question: What has been happening to the matter in the universe since the Big Bang occurred?

choices.answer: Matter has been stable and unmoving ever since.
Matter has moved outward and collected into galaxies.
Matter has moved from one end of the universe to another.
Matter is contracting and coming back together again.

questions.question: Which statement describes the Big Bang?

choices.answer: All matter in the universe expanded from a tiny point.
All matter appeared in its current location
Light waves condensed in a single area and matter formed.
Several galaxies collided and exploded.

questions.question: What does a star produce when it undergoes a supernova explosion?

choices.answer: Extremely small, energetic particles
Huge quantities of hydrogen
Mostly uranium and other radioactive elements
All the heaviest natural elements (atoms) found in the universe

questions.question: How do stars produce larger and heavier atoms during their lifespan?

choices.answer: The atoms fuse as the star goes through its life stages.
The atoms expand because they get hotter.
The atoms bond together in chemical reactions.
The atoms are attracted to each other electrically.

questions.question: A small star will produce what types of elements?

choices.answer: elements with smaller atomic masses.
elements that are mostly gases
elements that have large atomic masses
elements that are found on small planets

questions.question: Why is the Big Bang an accepted scientific theory?

choices.answer: Scientists voted on it.
The telescope helps us see other galaxies.
There isn't another good explanation.
Scientists continue to find evidence that supports it.
